intro: Acianthera dutrae, commonly known as the Dutra's orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a terrestrial orchid with a slender, upright stem and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom during the rainy season. The plant has a complex root system adapted to nutrient-poor soils, and its leaves are linear and slightly hairy. It is classified as critically endangered due to habitat loss and limited distribution. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique botanical species.
